bibl.title: Letter from Alexander M. Templeton to Mabel H. Lazear, January 31, 1927

div1.p: Templeton informs her that reference material on Jesse Lazear is being filed at the [Washington and Jefferson College] library.

div1.head: Letter from Alexander M. Templeton to Mabel H. Lazear, January 31, 1927
div1.opener:
LAW OFFICES OF
ALEX. M. TEMPLETON
WASHINGTON TRUST BUILDING
WASHINGTON, PENNSYLVANIA
JANUARY
31
1927
Mrs. Mabel H. Lazear,
6 Oakville Avenue,
Berkely, California.
My dear Mrs. Lazear:
div1.p:
Just a line to acknowledge receipt of
your letter and pamphlet, so you may know that neither
has gone astray. I shall write more at length later.
Meanwhile, great care will be taken of the pamphlet,
copies will be made of that part of it which refers
to Dr. Lazear, and the pamphlet itself returned to
you as soon as possible by registered mail. I thank you
very much.

I have just talked by telephone to the
librarian of our College Library who tells me that
she has been filing, for ready reference, everything
in print which had come to her notice with reference
to your husband. Apart from the fact she does this because
of the ma memorial in the library, she is also in-
terested because she is a sister of Dr. John L. Lowes,
now of Harvard, who, as I stated in a former letter,
was a member of the same college class here as your
husband and myself. I told her of what you had sent
me, and that I was going to copy all that referred to
Dr. Lazear, and she assured me that a copy, if filed
in the library, would be so cared for and indexed, that
it could be readily found, and she was very glad,
indeed, to know that this was available.
div1.closer: Very truly yours, Alex. M. Templeton. amt;b
